intro: Aspalathus hirta subsp. hirta, commonly known as the African red bush, is a member of the Fabaceae family and is native to South Africa. It is a small shrub characterized by its upright growth habit and dense foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from red to pink, typically blooming in summer. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive texture. Aspalathus hirta subsp. hirta is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy plant suitable for cultivation in similar conditions.
